src:
Detienen a Jaime "N" y a otro exfuncionario de la Fiscalía General de Veracruz
Se indicó que la aprehensión obedece a que realizaron un ejercicio indebido del servicio público
07 Nov 2019 by Alfredo Guillaumin | Diario de Xalapa
Xalapa, Ver.- Jaime “N” y Joao Jair “N” fueron detenidos esta noche por su presunta responsabilidad del delito de ejercicio indebido del servicio público. La aprehensión fue realizada por la Fiscalía General de Veracruz a través de la Policía Ministerial.
Los detenidos laboraban en la Fiscalía Especializada en Combate a la Corrupción y, conforme a una carpeta de investigación en su contra, se encontraron elementos que pudieran constituir la comisión del delito referido, razón por la cual un juez de control concedió la orden de aprehensión, indicó la Fiscalía.
En el caso de Jaime “N” no habría cumplido con los requisitos para ocupar el cargo que ostentaba, lo cual representaría una violación a la ley.
A ambos -indicó la Fiscalía- se les respetaron sus derechos humanos al momento de ser detenidos y conforme al Código Nacional de Procedimientos Penales se les respetará su presunción de inocencia.

NOTAS RELACIONADAS
text:
Jaime "N" and another former official of the Attorney General of Veracruz are arrested
It was indicated that the apprehension is due to the fact that they performed an improper exercise of the public service
07 Nov 2019 by Alfredo Guillaumin | Xalapa's Diary
Xalapa, Ver.- Jaime “N” and Joao Jair “N” were arrested tonight for their alleged responsibility for the crime of improper exercise of public service. The apprehension was carried out by the Attorney General of Veracruz through the Ministerial Police.
The detainees worked in the Office of the Special Prosecutor in Combating Corruption and, according to an investigation folder against them, elements were found that could constitute the commission of the referred crime, which is why a control judge granted the arrest warrant, The Prosecutor indicated.
In the case of Jaime “N” he would not have fulfilled the requirements to fill the position he held, which would represent a violation of the law.
Both - the Prosecutor's Office indicated - their human rights were respected at the time of their arrest and according to the National Code of Criminal Procedures their presumption of innocence will be respected.

RELATED NOTES
